{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3338246,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T14:07:47.029Z","cooked":"

Seems there are tons of discussions about networking, radios, Ethernet switches and momentary issues.
Here’s another.

We are using a roborio 2.0, Trendnet E-50 Ethernet switch and an Orange Pi 5 with two cameras.
On our practice field - we will get random robot disables during auto routines or during driving in teleop.
When we are stationary doing something like shooter calibration we don’t experience the robot disables.
Indication in logs when it does happen is usually the 44004 message.
We’ve swapped out the Trendnet switch with our spare Trendnet, changed every Ethernet cable, went from a Pololu 12V regulator to rhe 12V 2A out of a VRM to power the Trendnet switch, updated every firmware, library, patch and reformatted everything that could be formatted and we still had the problem.

Yesterday we decided to connect the radio directly to the roborio (via the Rev RPM) using the radio port 1 and then connecting the radio port 2 to the switch.

Problem seemed to go away.

So?

  1. What could possibly have been going wrong with our original configuration where we had the switxh betwen the roborio and the radio POE port1?
  2. There are tons of cautions about using that port 2 on the radio - but what’s the consensus on how we are using it now?
  3. That Trendnet Ethernet switch has a metal case with a chassis ground connection that we don’t have connected - but we do have the chassis screws to our belly pan - red herring or something to think about? Last year we had the switch on its side with double sided tape.
    EDIT - we just checked - the switch chassis is not isolated from the robot frame, so we I’ll be changing the mounting method. Last year we set it on its side and used double sided tape.
  4. What sort of hint (if any) is provided by thre fact that the unexpected robot disable doesn’t happen when the robot isn’t being driven, even if it’s actively being fed notes and shooting?

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:53:14.035Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":90,"reads":392,"readers_count":391,"score":543.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3338272,"name":"ErikSLee","username":"ErikSLee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erikslee/{size}/157434_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T14:29:22.949Z","cooked":"

We have seen these issues as well, and literally swapped out every component in the chain, not resolving. It sure feels to me like it is tied to the wpilib changes for 2024, as it started for us, on multiple robots right after upgrading to the 2024 wpilib.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T14:29:22.949Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"ErikSLee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/2","custom_user_title":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338331,"name":"kylelanman","username":"kylelanman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kylelanman/{size}/3427_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T14:57:01.725Z","cooked":"

As a CSA this past weekend we had 2 instances of switch disconnects and they were both traced back to an intermittent power connection coming out of the PDH. A visual inspection didn’t find it but tugging on wires caused the switch to reset.

We also had random robot disables with the 2024 wpilib software once we added an ethernet switch between our radio and roborio. We’re considering doing the same thing as you and using the second radio port, but it seems that might also cause issues.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:04:17.390Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":55.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63941,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338407,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T15:40:27.699Z","cooked":"

As a follow up - we haven’t been to a competition since we put that Trendnet switch onto the robot.
So we just checked - the metal chassis screwed connection we use to our belly pan results in a config that wouldn’t pass inspection.
I’m not sure if that contributes to our disable problem - but we will be changing things up so there’s no switch metal chassis touching any of the robots metal frame.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:41:12.905Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":55.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338423,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T15:52:46.543Z","cooked":"

This has nothing to do with WPILib. Software wise, the 2024 DS added control timeouts that weren’t present last year, so you might have had dropouts in previous years that simply went undetected. Make sure you’re on the latest DS version (either 2024 Game Tools Patch 1 or 2). Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Many teams are seeing ESD and/or power supply noise issues this year, and Ethernet switches seem particularly susceptible. If a switch has a metal chassis, it may or may not be legal to connect it to the robot chassis, depending on whether the metal chassis is isolated from the DC input ground. It is not legal to have an electrical connection between DC (battery) ground and the robot chassis (this is checked during inspection).

The increase in ESD-related issues this year probably stems from a few different factors, including swerve drives with plastic or rubber (instead of metal spoked) wheels, high-speed spinning plastic/rubber shooter wheels between sheets of polycarb with no grounding path, etc. Similarly, swerve drives create much more power supply noise than tank drives, so good power supply noise isolation/regulation is more important than ever.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:58:03.115Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":233,"readers_count":232,"score":126.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/yearly-overview/known-issues.html#driver-station-randomly-disabled","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/6","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338430,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T15:58:06.972Z","cooked":"

Thanks
We are up to Patch 2
And - see my updated info, we do have an illegal switch connection to the robot chassis - that we will of course fix.

We have been thinking about our disable problem being related to ESD (and switch susceptibility)
It never happened until we added the switch.

We have all kinds of rubber covered rollers spinning and a lowered swerve to where the frame is hardly off the carpet at all.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:58:39.632Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338644,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:06:42.054Z","cooked":"
Peter_Johnson:

swerve drives create much more power supply noise than tank drives, so good power supply noise isolation/regulation is more important than ever

Are you referring to capacitors in Game Manual R625 Blue Box? How does this apply to the 3 power leads to the brushless motors?

A noise filter may be wired across motor leads or PWM leads. Such filters will not
be considered CUSTOM CIRCUITS and violate neither this rule nor R712.
Acceptable signal filters must be fully insulated and must be 1 of the following:
− 1 microfarad (1 µF) or less, non-polarized, capacitor may be applied across
the power leads of any motor on your ROBOT (as close to the actual motor
leads as reasonably possible) or
− a resistor may be used as a shunt load for the PWM control signal feeding a
servo.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:06:42.054Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":58.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338654,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:14:16.364Z","cooked":"

No, I’m referring to the noise rejection capabilities of the power supplies used for the electronics in custom circuits. The main power bus of the robot (e.g. the outputs of the PDH) is extremely noisy due to motor loads. Electronics (e.g. the low-voltage processing cores and high-speed signaling in switches, coprocessors, etc) are sensitive to noise. The part in between (the power supplies / voltage regulators) play a critical part in not only operating through the voltage dips, but in filtering the noise so it doesn’t disrupt the operation of the sensitive electronics.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:16:52.199Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/9","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338946,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T21:52:52.038Z","cooked":"

With respect to noise affecting Ethernet switches - I’ve been reading posts about issues this year with various brands and models of switches.
I originally was powering our Trendnet via a Pololu 12V regulator - I don’t know exactly how well they th filter out the noise on your typical FRC robot, but in desperation we changed to a VRM instead of the Pololu and still had those random robot disables.

Again - we seem to be avoiding the disable issue by connecting the radio port 1 with the roborio and the Ethernet switch to the radio via port 2.

I’m not smart enough (or currently curious enough) to know whether or not the concerns you read about using port 2 on the radio are applicable here.
That 2019 Zebracorn white paper on Ethernet switching seems to imply we are ok.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T21:52:52.038Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3339000,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T22:45:15.438Z","cooked":"

Here is the exact text from the whitepaper:

Basically, the way that bug presents itself is that randomly upon startup the second port might not work until it the radio is rebooted. If every time you power on your robot, you verify that your coprocessors are connected correctly and reboot the robot if they are not, then you should be pretty safe. However that leaves it up to chance if your coprocessors will still work after a reboot on the field. If loosing them mid match doesn’t affect you that much then using both ports does reduce failure points in the RIO connection.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T22:45:15.438Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28067,"username":"JBENJI","name":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/11","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3339087,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-21T00:46:52.138Z","cooked":"

We are one of the teams that has read the zebra paper, considered the pros and cons, and decided to run direct from Rio to RPM to radio port 1, with our coprocessor on port 2. Our co processors are not Mission critical.

Ha!
I’d love to volunteer to try out the new radio, starting this weekend at CHS Falls Church.

Update to my OP - we’ve done enough configuration changes to be certain the disable problem is caused by having the Ethernet switch in the network.
I haven’t figured out exactly what’s going on with the switch and for now our coprocessor for vision processing is connected to radio port 2

Going off on a related but tangential direction here:

Given the trend toward swerve, the trend toward coprocessors, the fundamental nature of stuff that always has to spin on an FRC robot to pickup or shoot stuff….and the addition of Ethernet switches to network stuff together……what’s the new set of “best practices” to add to what’s already known (or should be) for FRC power and signal wiring?

Noise filters for sensitive components?
Shielded versus UTP Ethernet cables?
Research and go buy components intended for electrically noisy environments?

I have to admit - until this problem popped up for us, I hadn’t been giving any of this adequate thought.

Is there a thread somewhere that talks about “What is the port 2 issues” that others have experienced?

Is that mostly outlined in this thread?

Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead Technical
I noticed quite a few teams recently are running into an issue that I’m all too familiar with and I promised a few folks I would post this. I suspect this post will unintentionally ruffle someones feathers for some reason but I hope it doesn’t. I hope teams are able to read it and figure out some of the issues they have been having. The problem: So, you’re connecting your RoboRIO to your OpenMesh OM5P and you have a LimeLight or LemonLumen or PhotonCam or Jetson or Pi or whatever and you are…

That known issues was the first thing I went to and made sure we had patches, best practices, and so on.

Again - the disable problem only happens when we connect the roborio and radio via the Ethernet switch

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-21T13:40:06.856Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":24.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3339445,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-21T13:44:28.694Z","cooked":"

Yes, the main downside of using an Ethernet switch is it’s another thing that can fail in the Rio communication path. This is the first year that a significant number of teams have been reporting issues with that approach, probably due to some combination of ESD, swerve, and tighter DS timeouts. So it has always been a risk tradeoff, but perhaps has shifted this year.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-21T13:44:56.575Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459433,"topic_slug":"yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28067,"username":"JBENJI","name":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/yet-another-random-robot-disable-and-ethernet-switch-issue/459433/19","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3339475,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-21T14:04:47.276Z","cooked":"

Risk trade off I understand.
And given we can’t seem to get the Ethernet switch to work reliably (at least not before this weekends event most likely) we are going with the port 2 approach.
If it affects ability to process apriltags - so be it - at least we maintain comms between the radio and roborio.

Anyway one could say there’s a risk/benefit trade off for using something like Photonvision to improve pose and shooting accuracy - and vision means coprocessors and limelight’s and need for Ethernet switching.
And - game designers stuck a bunch of Apriltags around the field so we should be able to use them.

Let’s hope the new radio addresses most or all of this as an alternative to a separate Ethernet switch
